Legal_Issue: Whether persuasive decisions interfered with member's discretion
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant's primary motivation was economic; intention to return to Mexico
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate eligibility under Section 97
Credibility_Factor: Lack of credible fear of return
Legal_Rule: Refugee Protection Division must determine eligibility under Section 97
Procedural_Issue: Potential interference by persuasive decisions on independent decision-making
Grounds_for_Claim: Economic hardship and fear of persecution
Key_Evidence_Considered: Notes from immigration officers indicating economic motivation
Legal_Framework: Section 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Rule_Source: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Section 97
Defendant_Response: No indication of improper reliance on persuasive decisions
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet Convention refugee or person in need of protection criteria
Applicable_Process: Refugee protection hearing followed by judicial review
Governing_Rule: Standard of review for procedural fairness is correctness
